abstract: Clean tech is getting makeover from venture capital investors, who are shying away from high risks and costs of creating new forms of energy; instead, they are using software to cope with problems; venture capitalists will invest $275 million in 2011 in start-ups that make software and other technologies that conserve energy, up from $234 million in 2010.
snippet: Many investors are shying away from the high risks and costs of creating new forms of energy in favor of using software to cope with problems caused by climate change.
lead_paragraph: Many investors are shying away from the high risks and costs of creating new forms of energy in favor of using software to cope with problems caused by climate change.

headline.main: In Clean Tech, Venture Capital Looks for Problem-Solvers
headline.print_headline: In Clean Tech, Venture Capital Looks for Problem-Solvers
